𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 𝗜 𝗱𝗶𝗱𝗻'𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻 𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗰𝗼𝗿𝗽𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗵𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 (𝗶𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆) [Part 2]
If you can't work indefinitely, how will you provide?

Whether your entire career is before you or you're about to retire (read on to ADL), have you an answer?

I looked at the person who asked me that, (my face a big question mark as) I sheepishly said, "Family?" https://lnkd.in/gq3ZjD8D

[What about people without family?]

Some terms ...

Activities of Daily Living (ADL): life  tasks like bathing, continence, dressing, eating, toileting, transferring.

Long-Term Care refers to a range of services for individuals who can no longer perform at least two ADL independently. 

I never thought of the above scenario.

I most certainly didn't think of not being able to work indefinitely in my twenties!

Did you?

In uncertain times ...

✅ Do my Employer benefits (or other sources) cover catastrophic health expenses?

✅ What other options exist?

✅ What are family scenario implications?

✅ If the worst happened, what would my quality of life (care at home / facility) be?

[You'll have more options if you consider these when you're NOT in need].

Just like I tell job seekers, the best time to look is when you're not looking ...

Getting my drift?
